Articles.Content: So.. Using the Gemini add-on now and I have a quick question. I\'m still on the launch pad. How do I enter information for the orbit into which I want to launch? It auto launches the rocket into a 42.8 degree inclination, but what if I want it to launch into a 0 degree inc.?

Fly it manually?

I actually was doing that, but I\'m watching a video and trying to go into orbit while on youtube haha.

Hi Vincent, how are you?

Is there no help with this issue on the Orbiter forums? there\'d be more people there who\'d have tried this and would be able to help.

Hi Vincent, how are you?

Is there no help with this issue on the Orbiter forums? there\'d be more people there who\'d have tried this and would be able to help.

I think I have an account there, but it\'s a little less user friendly of a forum. I think there\'s a lot of people here that also play orbiter.

Vincent, we\'re not going to kill you.

http://i.imgur.com/vIbM8.png

http://i.imgur.com/YsZ0x.jpg

Just come and ask your questions!

I am not familiar with Gemini, but usually, that kind of things are done through LUA console (or LUA MFD). First - try to find something related to ascent autopilot in Gemini manual. Manuals can be in Docs folder or in addon docs folder.

Vincent, we\'re not going to kill you.

http://i.imgur.com/vIbM8.png

http://i.imgur.com/YsZ0x.jpg

Just come and ask your questions!

By user friendly, I didn\'t think the people were mean. I like the format and layout the KSP forums. It\'s easier to navigate and such.
